title: Task 1: Attribute a work of art to a specific artist, culture, art-historical style, or object type.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately attribute the work shown to the specific culture from the Indigenous Americas in which it was created.
Response accurately attributes the work shown to the specific culture from the Indigenous Americas in which it was created.

title: Task 2: Accurately uses specific visual evidence to justify the attribution by explaining similarities with work by a specific artist, culture, art-historical style, or object type represented in the image set.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately use specific VISUAL evidence to justify the attribution by describing ONE relevant similarity in FORM between the work shown and other work of the same type created by the same culture.

Response accurately uses specific VISUAL evidence to justify the attribution by describing ONE relevant similarity in FORM between the work shown and other work of the same type created by the same culture.

title: Task 3: Accurately uses specific visual evidence to justify the attribution by explaining similarities with work by a specific artist, culture, art-historical style, or object type represented in the image set.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately use specific VISUAL evidence to justify the attribution by describing ONE relevant similarity in CONTENT between the work shown and other work of the same type created by the same culture.

Response accurately uses specific VISUAL evidence to justify the attribution by describing ONE relevant similarity in CONTENT between the work shown and other work of the same type created by the same culture.

title: Task 4: Explain how the possible intent, purpose, and/or function shape the creation or meaning of a work of art.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT use specific contextual evidence to explain the function of this type of work.
Accurately uses specific contextual evidence to explain the function of this type of work.

title: Task 5: Explain how and/or why context influences artistic decisions about form, style, materials, content, and/or function in the creation or meaning of a work of art.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately use specific visual or contextual evidence to explain how the function of this type of work shaped either their form OR their content.
Response accurately uses specific visual or contextual evidence to explain how the function of this type of work shaped either their form OR their content.
